newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican daily port, shipping update for July 24.
newsitem.headline: Mexican daily port, shipping update for July 24.

text.p: All Mexican ports were open to major shipping on Thursday, the Communications and Transport Ministry (SCT) said in its 1000 local/1500 GMT daily meteorological report.

Crude shipping port Salina Cruz was shut for smaller tourism and fishing boats amid winds at more than 30 knots (32 miles/57 km per hour). Shipping was not limited for crude oil tankers headed across the Pacific, it said.
Rains were expected in the afternoon across the country, with strong wind gusts in the Gulf of Mexico. Tropical storms moving west along the Yucatan peninsula.
